meanings.definition: Feeling or showing envy of someone or their achievements.
meanings.sent1: She felt jealous when her friend got a new bike.
meanings.sent2: He looked jealous when his sister won the competition.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked jealous when the dog got a new toy.
meanings.sent4: The tree seemed jealous of the attention the flowers were getting.
meanings.sent5: The student's jealous expression was hard to miss.

meanings.definition: Feeling or showing suspicion of someone's unfaithfulness.
meanings.sent1: The detective was jealous of the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent2: She became jealous when she saw her partner with someone else.
meanings.sent3: The phone seemed jealous of the new gadget in the room.
meanings.sent4: The clouds looked jealous as the sun shone brightly.
meanings.sent5: His jealous eyes followed her every move.

meanings.sent1: The security guard was jealous of his post.
meanings.sent2: The dog was jealous of his bone, growling at anyone who came close.
meanings.sent3: The lock appeared jealous of the key that could open it.
meanings.sent4: The lion seemed jealous of its territory, roaring at intruders.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's jealous watch over the fort never wavered.
